item.title: Wood pallets & wardrobes, 20th November
item.description:
Someone has dumped a load of wooden pallets as well as broken wardrobes on the wall to our entrances. It look absolutely horrific and completely messy as it's piled so high
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hawthorn Grove, Anerley, London Borough of Bromley

item.title: 12 inch potholes in roadway causing issues with vehicles and London Buses., 20th November
item.description:
These potholes on the high road require filling in as within time may cause buses to ground their front end. They are in the road way out 365 High Road N17 opposite Ansanka Flavors

item.title: Constant rubbish dumping on this stretch of road, 20th November
item.description:
Constant rubbish dumping. Bins are all on street and this leads to endless associated dumping of anything and everything all of the time. Please take it away but please also address the underlying problem.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Blurton Road, Hackney, London

item.description:

item.title: Parking, 19th November
item.description:
Cars are parking inside Christopher close blocking emergency vehicles as well as rubbish trucks. These drivers live in nearby new build developments that have no parking or park here and drive to the station. Yellow lines need to be painted.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-6, Christopher Close, Rotherhithe, London Borough of Southwark

item.title: Late night roadworks, 19th November
item.description:
Yesterday TfL said that, after two nights of loud roadworks, they are now finished. Tonight there is yet more noise. Yet another sleepless night. All because TfL prioritise the convenience of some motorists over hundreds of Camden residents.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pratt Street, Kentish Town, Camden Town, London Borough of Camden

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Christopher Close, Rotherhithe, London Borough of Southwark

item.title: Street light STILL NOT WORKING, 19th November
item.description:
This street light not working has been reported NUMEROUS times. It has NEVER been fixed even though the case has been closed and Allegedly fixed. It is in Ronaldstone rd near Fen Grove. It is VERY DARK at that end of the road. THIS NEEDS TO BE FIXED
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Ronaldstone Road, Blackfen, Sidcup, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Police investigation needed, 19th November
item.description:
The discriminatory practices applied to street cleaning by Enfield council and the fraudulent claims need police investigation and must reflect greater ills. They have published a rota claiming church hill is cleaned once a week on a Wednesday. This is an actual lie. It is not. When the local Conservative councillors urge them to the council empty the bin on church hill and collect some leaves around it to make the bags appear full. The entire stretch of church hill is left filthy. The church itself is suffering an increase of litter which the council never remove. The church area on Compton road is also filthy and cleaned by a volunteer with learning needs. The mosque on Green lanes is regularly cleaned. It is really very concerning. More concerning are the lies that church hill is cleaned at all, let alone once a week. All other council practices including housing, and other areas of governance must be investigated as a matter of public urgency.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stone Hall Road, Southgate, Enfield, London Borough of Enfield
Report on FixMyStreet
